structure.unit: LIQUEFIED PETROLEUM GAS AND OTHER FLAMMABLE LIQUIDS

law.catch_line: Use by user-seller in own vehicles.
law.text:
Any holder of a liquefied petroleum gas motor fuel user-seller license, using liquefied petroleum gas as a motor fuel to propel motor vehicles upon the highways may fuel his own vehicles from storage where nontaxable liquefied petroleum gas is stored provided:
The state tax has been paid to the distributor or supplier of liquefied petroleum gas, who is licensed as a liquefied petroleum gas motor fuel dealer, on that portion intended for use on the highway; and further provided that
The liquefied petroleum gas storage facilities meet the requirements of this chapter and regulations promulgated thereunder.
law.history: Created 1960 Ky. Acts ch. 176, sec. 10, effective July 1, 1960.
